qas.question: To whom did Montini speak as an archbishop in the year 1957?

answers.text: Second World Congress of Lay Apostolate

qas.question: According to Montini was does the term apostolate mean?
How many nations did Montini hope to unify as Pro-secretary?
When was Montini's first meeting addressing the unification of Catholic lay followers?

context: Pius XII asked Archbishop Montini to Rome October 1957, where he gave the main presentation to the <a0_0>Second World Congress of Lay Apostolate<a0_0/>. Previously as Pro-Secretary, he had worked hard to unify a worldwide organization of lay people of <a2_0>58<a2_0/> nations, representing 42 national organizations. He presented them to Pius XII in Rome in <a3_0>1951<a3_0/>. The second meeting in 1957 gave Montini an opportunity to express the lay apostolate in modern terms: "Apostolate means <a1_0>love<a1_0/>. We will love all, but especially those, who need help... We will love our time, our technology, our art, our sports, our world."
